newsitem.title: UK: US trial for Shire Pharma's Reminyl started.
newsitem.headline: US trial for Shire Pharma's Reminyl started.

text.p: Drug development company Shire Pharmaceuticals Group Plc said on Monday that a Phase III clinical trial for its Reminyl drug for Alzheimer's disease had started in the United States.

The company said patient enrolment for the double-blind, placebo-controlled trial, which was being undertaken by Johnson & Johnson unit Janssen Pharmaceutica NV, had already begun and was expected to proceed very rapidly in coming months.
The U.S. company is Shire's co-development and licensing partner for Reminyl, which is derived from daffodil bulbs.
Shire's 60-centre Phase III study of Reminyl is already under way in Europe, involving some 500 patients. Results of the double-blind phase are due in mid-1997.
Interim results of Shire's Phase II studies with Reminyl showed a significant improvement in cognitive performance in patients with Alzheimer's-type dementia, the company said.
In late September, Shire said Johnson & Johnson had already paid it about eight million stg for Reminyl, or galanthamine hydrobromide, since November 1995.
